definition: lit. look into one's heart, no shame (idiom); with a clear conscience

sentences.english: A clear conscience is a soft pillow.
But I don't have anything like this serenity when I'm writing an essay.
sentences.chinese: 但我写文章时却一点也没法问心无愧。

sentences.english: Now Amy can serve this favorite with a clear conscience.
sentences.chinese: 现在埃米可以问心无愧地提供这种美味了。

sentences.english: Honestly, you go where sufficient affordable are carried head.
sentences.chinese: 问心无愧，已足够你走到哪里都抬得起头。

sentences.english: In resigning, Mr. Yates said, 'I have acted with complete integrity and my conscience is clear, ' he said
sentences.chinese: 耶茨在辞职时说，我行事诚实正直，问心无愧。

sentences.english: We advocate commercial reputation and morality as to fulfill the desire FOR unashamed pleasure.
sentences.chinese: 本店崇尚商誉商德，以期得到问心无愧的满足。

sentences.english: A clear conscience is usually a sign of a bad memory.
sentences.chinese: 问心无愧，一般是记性差的表现。

sentences.english: We are trying, treasure, a clear conscience.
sentences.chinese: 我们努力了，珍惜了，问心无愧。

sentences.english: A clear conscience laughs at false accusation.
sentences.chinese: 只要问心无愧，无端指责可一笑置之。

sentences.english: A clear  conscience is usually the sign of a bad memory.
sentences.chinese: 问心无愧也许是坏记性的表现。

definition: lit. look into one's heart, no shame (idiom); with a clear conscience
open and candid (idiom); straightforward and upright
to conduct oneself/to behave with integrity
(to play) one's part/one's role/one's duty/(to stay within) one's bounds/dutiful/keeping to one's role
to have a clear conscience/to feel no qualms
to have a clear conscience/to have no qualms about sth
to be of service to others/to help others/benevolent
